channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HIVE-20385] Date: date + int fails to add days
item.description:
select current_date + 5;

FAILED: SemanticException [Error 10014]: Line 1:7 Wrong arguments '5': No matching method for class org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.udf.generic.GenericUDFOPDTIPlus with (date, int)

This works in Postgres 9.6 - http://sqlfiddle.com/#!17/9eecb/19253/0
item.summary: Date: date + int fails to add days

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
The immediate workaround is to disambiguate the operation by specifying "days".

hive> select current_date +5 days ;
OK
2018-08-19 00:00:00

-1 overall

ATTACHMENT ID: 12939529 - PreCommit-HIVE-Build

gopalv The test failures are known issues and unrelated to the fix. Do we need a new test run or can we proceed with resolving?

Thanks.

bpusztahazi Return type for date + int (or date - int) should be date and not timestamp.
Yes, we need to rerun the tests to get a clean run before we can push this change in.
I don't think it would be desireable to start interpreting TIMESTAMP+INT ; I feel that without specifying the unit the result of it is somewhat undefined...
kgyrtkirk: Agree (date+int) is the only safe one to do. Timestamp math is dangerous because Hive has a bit of bad history there hidden behind a config var (hive.int.timestamp.conversion.in.seconds)

-1 overall
